headline: Morning Movers: Tesla, IBM slipping following quarterly reports
summary: Stock futures were modestly lower as disappointing quarterly results from major tech names weighed on sentiment. Markets look set to open with a muted tone, reflecting a mix of elevated risk and uncertainty. Oil surged nearly 4% after the U.S. imposed fresh sanctions on Russia’s top oil companies, creating a shockwave across energy markets and raising inflation concerns. Concurrently, the dollar firmed against major currencies ahead of a delayed U.S. consumer-price report, while the yen weakened

headline: Blackstone (BX) Margin Beat Challenges Valuation Concerns as Community Debates Sustainability
summary: Blackstone (BX) posted a net profit margin of 21.2%, edging higher than last year’s 20.2%, with EPS growth jumping 43.5% over the past year. This defied a previous five-year trend of a 10.4% annual decline. Wall Street is watching closely as forecasts now call for 14.1% annual earnings growth and 20.1% revenue growth each year, ahead of the broader US market’s 10% pace. Although operational momentum looks strong thanks to recent profitability gains, valuation concerns and notable risks around...

headline: BX Q3 Deep Dive: Private Credit and Real Estate Trends Dominate as Margins Face Pressure
summary: Alternative investment manager Blackstone (NYSE:BX) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, but sales rose 20.2% year on year to $2.93 billion. Its GAAP profit of $0.80 per share was 34.8% below analysts’ consensus estimates.
